---------- Forwarded message ---------
De: Gisela Tartaglia <gtartaglia@mate.unlp.edu.ar>
Date: lun, 11 oct 2021 a las 8:29
Subject: Seminario Geometría Noconmutativa : Martes 12/10 10 hs
To: 


Hola, este martes a las 10:00hs tendremos el seminario virtual de Geometría Noconmutativa del Atlántico Sur (GeNoCAS).

En esta oportunidad va a hablar Jintao Deng (Waterloo)

Title: The K-theory of Roe algebras and the coarse Baum-Connes conjecture

Abstract:
The coarse Baum-Connes conjecture claims that a certain assembly is an isomorphism. It has important applications in the study of the existence of a metric with positive scalar curvature and the Novikov conjecture on the homotopy invariance of the higher signature on a manifold. In this talk, I will talk about the Roe algebras which encode the large-scale geometry of a metric space. The higher index of an elliptic operator is an element of the K-theory of this algebra. The coarse Baum-Connes conjecture provides an algorithm to compute its K-theory. I will talk our recent result that the coarse Baum-Connes conjecture holds for the relative expanders constructed by Arzhantseva and Tessera. I will also talk about a recent result on the equivariant coarse Baum-Connes conjecture.
